properties.description: Seven Tepees Youth Program works with youth in grades 6-12, providing support with an emphsasis on social competency, self-esteem, academics, the natural environment, and preparing for future success. 7 Tepees pairs mentors with kids to build strong, stable relationships. 7 Tepees usually has a waiting list for all grades.
properties.categories: middle school, high school, career/college, tutoring/mentoring, leadership/empowerment, health/wellness, sports, counseling, arts, free/low cost, accepts volunteers

properties.description: 826 Valencias has trained tutors to help students with their homework, creative writing, expository writing, or English as a second language. Students have to be enrolled to attend the after school tutoring, but there is drop-in tutoring on Sundays open to all.
properties.categories: elementary school, middle school, high school, career/college, tutoring/mentoring, arts, free/low cost, accepts volunteers

properties.description: Mission Girls work with Latina girls ages 9-14 in a number of personal enrichment programs, and meets Monday through Friday, 3-6pm.
properties.categories: elementary school, middle school, high school, career/college, leadership/empowerment, health/wellness, tutoring/mentoring, free/low cost, accepts volunteers

properties.description: Like any other Boys & Girls Club, the Mission branch offers a wealth of activities. Membership is open to kids 6-18 and costs $10 for the year. The club is open Monday-Friday after school and in the evening.
properties.categories: elementary school, middle school, high school, tutoring, arts, sports, leadership/empowerment, free/low cost, accepts volunteers

properties.description: Like any other Boys & Girls Club, the Columbia Park branch offers a wealth of activities. Membership is open to kids 6-18 and costs $10 for the year. The club is open Monday-Friday after school and in the evening.
properties.categories: elementary school, middle school, high school, tutoring, arts, sports, leadership/empowerment, free/low cost, accepts volunteers
properties.organization: Boys and Girls Club, Columbia Park

properties.description: The Mission Branch of the SF Public Library offers free homework to anyone who needs it, Tuesdays-Thursdays.
properties.categories: elementary school, middle school, high school, tutoring/mentoring, free/low cost, accepts volunteers
properties.organization: San Francisco Public Library, Mission Branch

properties.description: Horizons offers a broad range of programs and services, including music and employment programs, that are designed to meet the diverse needs of youth.
properties.categories: middle school, high school, arts, sports, health/wellness, counseling, leadership/empowerment, tutoring/mentoring

properties.description: The Community Music Center offers several different programs for youth, including a children's chorus and a teens' chorus, and instruction in numerous instruments and styles including jazz, Latin and classical.
properties.categories: elementary school, middle school, high school, arts, free/low cost, accepts volunteers

properties.description: The Mission Learning Center helps children who read below grade level increase their literacy skills. Meets Monday-Thursday.
properties.categories: elementary school, tutoring/mentoring, free/low cost, accepts volunteers

properties.description: The Precita Valley Community Center offers a wealth of programs and support to youth, including GED classes, gender specific leadership classes, health education and violence prevention, among many others.
properties.categories: elementary school, middle school, high school, counseling, tutoring/mentoring, health/wellness, sports, arts, leadership/empowerment, career/college, free/low cost, accepts volunteers

properties.description: Other than providing programs directly to Mission schools, Good Samaritan Family Resource Center works onsite with high schoolers every Friday, promoting leadership and cultural enrichment. They also work with parents to help them get involved with their child's education.
properties.categories: high school, parent, leadership/empowerment, free/low cost, accepts volunteers

properties.description: Mission Graduates offer a plethora of activities directly within Mission schools, but also provides onsite parental support to get parents involved with their children's education.
